channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Constant weekly flytipping as no signs or fines, 20th January
item.description:
Me again! Multiple reports all winter. Estates team will next plant here - items ordered Signage /flyers still actually needed around this estate as believe they just dump at garages instead after planting. Fines best CCTV asked for by Cllr Gavin Edwards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gibbon Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not coming on, 20th January
item.description:
The heritage lamp on Kelsey Lane near Kelsey Square behind 2 Coopers Mews BR3 1AJ is not coming on. It makes walking on the pavement very dark in this area. I seem to report this fault almost every year, even since the switch to LED?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Loose cycle lane divider on West Smithfield, 20th January
item.description:
The bolt-down divider between the cycle lane and the main carriageway nearest to the Stop sign/junction with Snow Hill is broken. It keeps coming loose and getting moved by traffic. This is a danger to cycles as it is dark coloured and not visible and often migrates to block the cycle track going downhill towards farringdon street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Snow Hill, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping issue continues unresolved, 20th January
item.description:
Further to ref: 8676867 and ref: 8682206, the issue of constant fly tipping, with black rubbish bags and other rubbish being left out in the communal pathway, continues unresolved week after week. This latest instance occurred during the day on 20 Jan. Attention to this matter is urgently needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Croxley Green stop J it's been reported and TFL said it has been fixed it has antisemetic and racist. "all jews are vermin" "reform says no black", 20th January
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)

item.title: Fly Tipping - Wooden Pallets, 20th January
item.description:
Several bits of wood dumped on the road. Initially these were going into the road and stopping cars going by. Local residents have placed it against the wall so it’s out of the way i but please can someone come and get rid of it

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead

item.title: Double yellow lines need extending, 20th January
item.description:
When vehicles park legally right by the double yellow lines you cannot make it around the island with a bus needs extending upto the lamppost so buses can safely make it around otherwise will be continually mounting the island and we risk damages to buses
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wells Park Road, Forest Hill, Greater London
